page.title: 09GRANGE FARM, HOCKWOLD
page.content: Grange Farm is on the side of a low hill. It is quite a small farm, about a hundred and sixteen hectares. We are near a man made river but the soil is chalky and dry. We employ one person but we've increased the time necessary for casual workers because of the crops we grow. These are winter wheat, winter barley, spring barley, grass,(for seed) onions, sugar beet, rough grass for cows and gherkins. While we have been here we have made changes to the buildings and put up new ones. We've changed the storage and joined a co-operative onion group. We sell them with other people to get a better price and sell them to the supermarket. The most significant change is the payments with the E.E.C. from Europe. The quotas imposed on milk might happen to other things.
